title: What are some good examples on when to use 2 commas in a sentence? - Quora

response.answer_text: Dave, I have posted multiple blog posts about when to use commas: with such aswith the conjunction andwhere to place a comma with other punctuationuse in email salutationswhat is the Oxford commaHere’s a link where you can explore the explanations, some of which include specifically when to use more than one comma, along with examples: comma use | Ruthless Editor

Commas create a “micro-pause” that helps the reader take in the created meaning as clearly as language can allow. Often a pair of commas is needed to separate out a complete phrase or clause slightly, one that is “embedded” inside another clause and needs some pausing to be properly accounted for by the reader. These are called parenthetical commas because they act like brackets, to add in some subordinate information to a main clause or other superior grammatical unit. Here is an example: “The elephant, [which was] charging like crazy in all directions, needed careful handling.” “The cars that were winning the race, albeit not a proper “race” as such, were not the electric models.”
